CONJUGATES: defect (n. sg.) | defects (n. pl.) | defect (v. base) | defects (v. 3rd sg.) | defecting (v. pres. part.) | defected (v. past & p.p.)
ETYMOLOGY: From Latin *defectus* 'a failing, desertion, revolt', past participle of *deficere* 'to fail, fall short, desert', from *de-* 'down, away' + *facere* 'to make, do'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, things, or abstract ideas.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A shortcoming, imperfection, or fault in something, especially one that makes it imperfect or dysfunctional.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （产品、系统、人等存在的）缺陷；缺点；毛病
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The car was recalled due to a serious manufacturing defect in its braking system.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 该车因刹车系统存在严重制造缺陷而被召回。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: An intransitive verb is a verb that does not take a direct object.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To abandon one's country or cause in favor of an opposing one.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 叛逃；变节（指叛离自己国家、政党或事业投向敌对一方）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: During the Cold War, many spies defected from one side to the other.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 冷战期间，许多间谍从一方叛逃到另一方。
